page.title: 05 Hull and Hornsea Railway
page.content:
The Hull and Hornsea{Railway}was built and opened in 1864 and became the rail link for the North East Railway. It contained 33km of double track which started at Wilmington Junction and finished in Hornsea. Now the old track has been changed into a tarmaced{footpath.}The old bridges have collapsed or been replaced with new concrete ones. Sutton-on-Hull and Swine stations are of{local historical}interest. Sutton station was demolished to make way for a playground and the B1237{ {road.}Swine station still stands but has been gutted by fire. It was converted to a Kingston Training Workshop.
{Continued on page 6 }
